subject: Politics
title: General Strikes
description: Learn General Strikes in one minute.

hook.text: When everyone stops working, the economy stops. General strikes bring governments to their knees without weapons.

buildup.text: A general strike means workers across all industries refuse to work until demands are met. It paralyzes the state.

discovery.text: Poland's Solidarity movement used strikes to challenge communist rule. Ten million workers joined.

twist.text: General strikes require massive coordination and solidarity. If key sectors keep working, the strike loses its power.

climax.text: Sudan's 2019 general strike helped topple dictator Omar al-Bashir after 30 years of authoritarian rule.

punchline.text: Strikes turn economic power into political power. Stop work, stop the state.

quiz.question: How many workers joined Poland's Solidarity movement?
